## Analysis

I have $0, so I cannot buy anything from the shop. I cannot reroll either since that costs $5.

Looking at the previous actions:
- Turn 41: I used Venus to level up Three of a Kind
- Turn 42: I bought the Arcana Pack for $4
- Turn 43: I selected The Lovers and enhanced the Queen of Diamonds into a Wild Card

Now I'm back in the shop with $0. The only option I have is to proceed to the round select screen since I cannot afford any purchases.

The Boss Blind requires 1600 chips. Looking at my hand from Turn 43, I had:
- King of Hearts (+10 chips)
- Jack of Hearts (+10 chips)
- 10 of Hearts (+10 chips)
- 7 of Hearts (+7 chips)


- Queen of Diamonds (now Wild Card after using The Lovers)
- 7 of Spades (+7 chips)
- 8 of Clubs (+8 chips)
- 8 of Diamonds (+8 diamonds)

Since the Queen is now a Wild Card, I can form a Heart flush using King, Jack, 10, 7 of Hearts plus the Queen, which gives me a flush with three face cards scoring. The base flush provides 35 chips and 4x multiplier, with the face cards adding 10 chips each and Smiley Face providing +5 mult per face card.

Calculating the total: 35 base chips plus 47 from the cards equals 82 chips, then multiplied by the 19x multiplier (4 base plus 15 from Smiley Face) and boosted by Constellation's 1.2x modifier, reaching approximately 1870 chips—well above the 1600 requirement. With no funds available, I'll move forward to round_select.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

Let me analyze the current game state carefully.

## Current Situation

2. Constellation - X1.2 Mult (gains X0.1 per Planet card used)
3. Half Joker - +20 Mult if played hand contains 3 or fewer cards

Tags: None (the Investment Tag was used up after beating the boss)

## Shop Options
Cards:
1. Splash - Every played card counts in scoring, +50 chips, Foil edition - $5
2. Lusty Joker - Played cards with Heart suit give +3 Mult when scored - $5

Boosters:
1. Standard Pack - Choose 1 of up to 3 Playing cards - $4
2. Jumbo Arcana Pack - Choose 1 of up to 5 Tarot cards - $6

Vouchers:
1. Wasteful - Permanently gain +1 discard each round - $10

Reroll cost: $5

## Analysis

I have $32 to spend. Ante 3 will be harder, so I need to prepare well.

Looking at my hand levels:
- Three of a Kind: Level 3 (70 chips, 7 mult) - my most played hand
- Full House: Level 3 (90 chips, 8 mult)
- Most other hands are Level 1

My joker setup is:
- Smiley Face synergizes with face cards


- Constellation scales with Planet cards
- Half Joker rewards small hands (3 or fewer cards)

Splash Joker is tempting since it lets all played cards contribute chips to the score, even outside of hand formations. The +50 chips base value plus Foil's +4 chips bonus makes it a solid chip generator. However, I need to consider whether this fits my current strategy better than other options like Lusty Joker, which would add multiplier through Heart suits.

Standard Pack could introduce a useful card to my deck, while Jumbo Arcana Pack offers Tarot enhancements. Wasteful Voucher would increase my discard count from 4 to 5 per round, giving me more flexibility in hand selection.

As I move into Ante 3 with tougher blinds, I need to prioritize scoring power. Splash Joker's ability to make every card count toward chips is particularly appealing for scaling my overall damage output. So if I play 5 cards with Splash, they all score but Half Joker won't activate—that's the trade-off. With just 3 cards, Splash still helps and Half Joker triggers, though the three cards might already be scoring anyway if they form the hand type.

Splash feels less impactful with Three of a Kind since those cards are already contributing. Wasteful could be better for flexibility—more discards mean better odds of assembling strong hands. The Jumbo Arcana Pack is also tempting since I have unused Tarot cards and room in my consumable slots.

For Ante 3, I need to significantly boost my chip output. Planet cards would level up my hands and scale Constellation, while Tarot cards could enhance my deck. I'm leaning toward the Arcana Pack for $6, then Wasteful for $10, leaving me $16 remaining from my $32 budget. That gives me cushion for rerolls or other upgrades.

But I should evaluate the full shop first. Splash at $5 could be powerful for chip scaling, though it conflicts with Half Joker. Lusty Joker might work if I pivot to Hearts, but my current deck doesn't support that well. The Arcana Pack seems like the safest choice to unlock new enhancement options and see what Tarot cards become available.

I'll prioritize Wasteful for the permanent discard flexibility, then grab the Arcana Pack. That leaves me with $16 to adapt based on what I discover.
